html:
joyous city, whose antiquity is of ancient days. Tyre took pride and joy in her prosperity and antiquity, and Isaiah mocks her inhabitants with a question that essentially asks, "Where is your joyous, bustling city now?" (22:2; 32:13).

her own feet shall carry her afar off to sojourn. After the destruction of their city, Tyre's refugees will migrate to distant places.
